column4: how could I find out what device (ie /dev/ttyS1, /dev/cua0, etc) my bluetooth USB adapter uses?
usually info would be in via dmesg
dmesg shows next to nothing.  lsusb will show the device name, but nothing more.
when was the dongle plugged in? before/during or after bootup?
right now - dmesg only shows "usb 4-2: new full speed USB device using ohci_hcd and address 3" & "usb 4-2: configuration #1 chosen from 1 choice" when it's plugged in
oh it works fine - i just need the info to try and get Wammu working
which version of ubuntu are you using?
the version that can't be mentioned in this channel
ah ha, because you don't have support in that channel or?
yeah I've figured that out, but what you've tried their channels with no answer?
have you actually given it a go with karmic or jackalope instead of heading towards lucid?
it's all good man, thanks for trying :)
actually the firewall isn't turned on in Ubuntu by default
more like what I thought as not configured, i.e. nothing on the rules table
